website_summaries.verdict: A traditional travel pillow for people seeking direct support on their neck and head when they sleep on an airplane. Comfortable and compressible makes it convenient for a variety of uses.
pros: Durable fabric that resists scratches and stains in case of a spill or accident
Pillow is just large enough to provide adequate support for an average size head
cons: Traditional design won't support the neck and head from moving while sleeping

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for airplane!
customer_reviews.text: My dad originally purchased one of these for a camping pillow and told me about it when I recently complained about not sleeping well on an airplane. I purchased one for my return flight and I was so happy I did!!!!!! I just put it up against the wall (window seat) and slept like a baby! I ordered the medium size and was surprised at how small it rolled up. It was nice to place behind my back when I wasn’t sleeping. I’ve included a picture of it rolled up. Salad dressing bottle for size reference.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna Schavrien

customer_reviews.title: Cancer causing, cheap
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box, cheap low qualitg the blue part is not even close to being soft or comfortable to rest your head on. The foam was all over the outside of the pillow and theres a tag labeled "Cancer causing materials used"
customer_reviews.author: Elisha

customer_reviews.title: Pretty useless except maybe as an arm-rest
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in preparation for a very long flight where I wanted to sleep more comfortably than the small airline pillows would enable me to do. Two things I found about this pillow: One, it just does not fluff up nearly big enough to provide any comfort, and Two, it does not squish down small enough to be packed easily... I used it mostly as an arm-rest and left it on the plane at end of the flight. Waste of money basically.
customer_reviews.author: Washington Veteran

customer_reviews.title: Okay, not great. Pictures from reviews did not reflect my experience
customer_reviews.text: I'm kind of disappointed in this product. Lots of online reviews raving about this for travelling but when I took this for a trip to india it did not inflate to the same extent that other reviewer pictures showed. Also it wsnt all that comfortable. However I gave it two stars because it did provide some relief on the plane ride, just not very fluffy.
customer_reviews.author: wayne

customer_reviews.title: Great for Travel, Needs more fluff though
customer_reviews.text: When I first received the pillow, it was really clunky and flat. However, the pillow began to fluff up over the next few days and it eventually became a full pillow. In terms of comfort, it was an average pillow. It's pretty good for a camping pillow but it doesn't feel amazing. In terms of portability, the pillow folds fairly well into itself. You basically roll the pillow into itself to make it 1/3 of the size.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin C

customer_reviews.title: Great Travel Pillow
customer_reviews.text: These are great travel pillows. I finally reached an age where I no longer regard a travel pillow as a luxury. I travel a lot in Africa where pillows, if available, are hard as rock and smell like mildew. This pillow is a good size and has just the right amount of support. The wild color and design is really great but if you are travelling over dusty roads you will need to keep it in a plastic bag and/or carry a pillowcase. This is the second pillow I have bought - I left the other in a hotel room. Note to self: travel with an outrageously colored pillow case so you can't miss it on the bed.
customer_reviews.author: JLC

customer_reviews.title: Not for airline travel
customer_reviews.text: This is a great travel pillow but it has a few minor flaws. 1) when it's been rolled up for a while it takes a while to expand and fill up the pillow case space. 2) if you're looking at this product for airline travel, which I did, It tends to be a bit too bulky for a tight space like an airplane seat. But all in all it would be a great pillow for camping or a road trip so if you're looking for a pillow for that type of use I would recommend this product. Just be aware of its limitation.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Expands quite a bit to a hard pillow.
customer_reviews.text: This expands over 4-5 hours to make a hard pillow. I opened up the seam to find a lot of large foam pieces. I removed almost all of the foam and replaced it with a much finer shredded memory foam from another pillow which allowed for adjustment by having a zipper to access interior foam. I would suggest this as an improvement to this nice pillow. I like that you can roll it up and secure it into a small size. But a finer foam and an access area would be nice. The price point is ok, considering the small size.
customer_reviews.author: Jayne

customer_reviews.title: Quality pillow
customer_reviews.text: I bought the medium and large sizes because it was hard to determine the best size for me (difficult to tell based on Amazon pix). The pillows are quality constructed and the material very comfortable. The pillows themselves take a while (4-6 hrs) to expand fully (tho are still suitable for use earlier- just not as full). Unfortunately because the pillows do "fill" so well, they also don't pack down all that well (perhaps half the size of full expansion). If packability is less of an issue than comfort and usability then these pillows are an excellent deal.
customer_reviews.author: Globe Trotter

customer_reviews.title: Cover gets sticky
customer_reviews.text: It's a lifesaver when camping or after a long day hiking.. but I do wish they would use a different covering other than the suede type of material. Sometimes I think product designers don't sweat or have any oils on their skin, hence products like this.. Well after a long day hiking in the humid Appalachians, this thing was sticking to the side of my head like an alien. Put a shirt around it, and all was well. But really? There's got to be a better outside material.
customer_reviews.author: tcp100Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Don''t bother!
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with this pillow and it is being returned. I agree with the previous negative reviews - a rolled up sweatshirt would be more effective! I bought the small size, hoping to use it for a long international flight. The size would be perfect, but the pillow is very understaffed, and stuffed cube shaped, making for an inconsistent feel. It was also extremely difficult to get rolled back up properly and into the attached pouch. I cannot imagine this pillow giving me any support whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Krause

customer_reviews.title: Lumpy and no support
customer_reviews.text: I unfortunately would not recommend this pillow. The pictures show a pillow that is full (not floppy and lumpy). I tried to let the pillow sit out (not compressed) for 2 full days, separated the chunks of foam and hoped it would fill out. Unfortunately it didn't. I shook the chunks of foam to the bottom of 1 side and tried to use it to support my neck, but it didn't. I ended up balling up a tshirt as a pillow instead. I'm returning the pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Annemarie H

customer_reviews.title: The stuffing in this pillow is so chunky it's very ...
customer_reviews.text: The stuffing in this pillow is so chunky it's very uncomfortable. I am going to take it to my alternations store and have them re-stuff with softer material. I would have sent it back but one I got it open it expanded so much I couldn't get it back in the container.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy Pavone

customer_reviews.title: Convenient & comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as pictured. It took a little while after I unpacked it to fluff up, but it did fluff quite nicely. The problem was trying to roll it back up—it does, but not as neatly or as compressed as it originally came. It took me a few minutes to crush it enough to get it back into its attached travel pouch. I used it for a trans-Atlantic flight and it was quite comfy. It is a bit lumpy from the , but that doesn’t diminish its comfort. I used it both as lumbar support when I was sitting up and then as a pillow (leaning against the window) when I napped. Overall, a good travel pillow.
customer_reviews.author: L. Long

customer_reviews.title: filled with semi hard chunks
customer_reviews.text: Has to be one of the worst purchases I've made - took it out of the package, unwrapped it - cover is very loose, so guessed it would 'unbind' itself. Nope. have absolutely no idea why this is filled with 'chunks' of what feels like semi-hard foam offcuts. Days later and still not 'fluffed' ... I see a wide variation here from great to terrible - maybe this is made from the leftovers from their mattresses - whatever it is - they need to change and go for consistency. I'll be wrapping it in a towel for now - and may return it just before that option expires. Total fraud as a listing.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Kintner

customer_reviews.title: Very Lousy
customer_reviews.text: Here is the good -- travels well and is easy to compress. Here is what is not good -- it is ridiculously lumpy. I bought it for an adventure trip and didn't unpack it until I arrived. My fault. I should have given it breathing room. However, after one week unroloed, it was still lumpy. I was too prepared, buying it it so long before my trip it is too late to return. What a drag.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Not really light enough for easy backpacking, but nice enough that I use it for backpacking anyway
customer_reviews.text: I’m very picky about pillows, and typically a lightweight backpacker, so camp pillows are a constant issue. Lightweight/packable ones provide no support, aren’t big enough, have weird fabrics that stick to my face, and often are noisy (air/plastic crinkles). This pillow is not lightweight, but it’s somewhat compact, and more importantly, it’s actually useful. I make space for it in my pack, and sleep much better. It doesn’t stick to my face. The elastic closure toggle is sometimes annoying, since it’s exposed, but usually tolerable because I can just turn the pillow over. I got the large size. The medium probably would have been good enough.
customer_reviews.author: J.B.Top Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Let air for a day or two, wash and dry to inflate
customer_reviews.text: I was really disappointed when I first unrolled the pillow because it was just sad and floppy. I've recently bought a few memory foam mattresses, and decided to give it some time to expand and see if i wanted to keep it. After a couple of days, it had opened pretty fully, and i decided to try as some other suggested and wash/dry it. That was the cherry on top - after washing and drying with some wool dryer balls, it puffed up to max fullness. It is nice and soft and feels fairly supportive. I haven't tried to travel yet or sleep a full night, but this should be a nice addition to the too soft/too absent hotel pillows.
customer_reviews.author: Super Cheech

customer_reviews.title: Best pillow out there
customer_reviews.text: Best pillow I found for hammock camping just one thing therma rest could do to make it better is put a tether on it so could keep in place on string but I sewed my own tether on it and a little more stuffing would be nice. It beats all those inflatable pillows that are to cold in the winter and change pressure with temperature so your either taking air out at night or adding to keep inflatable pillows to your comfort level. After getting this pillow and it packs down nice in my pack back I won't go back to inflatable. This is most comfortable packable pillow to use period.
customer_reviews.author: Togwote

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by this item. For some reason, I was expecting a mini memory foam pillow like I have at home. It’s actually filled with little expandable foam pieces. It was actually kinda fun to play with them as it just got fuller and fuller. I followed the instructions to wash and dry, and was happy to see it was very full and comfortable. I travel quite a bit, and will love having this on the plane and as an extra in hotels (I’ve found that internationally you never know the quality, size, and number of pillows you’ll have!) i recommend this. I got medium, perfect for my traveling purposes, but if camping, I’d definitely go bigger!
customer_reviews.author: soccer mom

customer_reviews.title: convenient, not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Easy to wash, dry & pack. Fluffs up well. Washed & dried before using to help 'fluff'. Color is true to picture, material s soft, comfortable. Comfort for sleep: I did not find this to fit my preferences. Should have ordered larger size, was just not comfortable .....maintains a 'roundish' shape...did not compress enough for me..probably ok for most people, I am used to having a contoured pillow due to neck issues. My week of camping, every night I tried it, every night it ended up on tent floor..
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: A truly wonderful backpacking pillow
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful pillow! Just be sure to throw it in the washer & dry on a warm cycle before using the first time, to let it recover from compression for shipping. Fluffs right up. Rolls into integral pocket built in to the cover for packing. I got the medium size - perfect for backpacking use in tent or backpacking hammock - or for my yard hammock. Rolls up small to take up little space in my pack & weight is negligible compared to the comfort of a good night’s sleep. So much nicer than my old solution of a jacket in a stuff sack.
customer_reviews.author: Will Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Chunks of foam
customer_reviews.text: I do not understand the hype over this thing. No matter how long you leave it to spring back to shape, you distinctly feel the chunky, shredded foam pieces in the pillow. (You also feel yourself sinking through said chunks, unless you fold it in half, or put it on its narrow edge.) I took this hiking, and was twice disappointed - once by the lack of comfort or support, and once again by the inability to compress it in a useful way - that rinky-dink drawstring doesn't do much. I didn't expect this from a company with Therm-a-Rest's reputation for lightweight/travel sleep support.
customer_reviews.author: that's-not-my-name

customer_reviews.title: One ding for a tear.
customer_reviews.text: I have had one of these for many years, holds up well. Used on my river adventures and now in our van travels. It is the My pillow original I think. You fluff it up to get to your full fluffed desire and it holds up under your knoggin. I bought two one for a gift exchange and one for my Hubby for Christmas, it was fought over at exchange, and loved as a gift, but the gift one had a tear in a seam when opened so I just returned re ordered, no problem with Amazon, Hopefully the other was OK, and the replacement was perfect. I got all Larges which are fine for the average brain!
customer_reviews.author: captain "I"

customer_reviews.title: Works well for the most part
customer_reviews.text: So a lot of other reviews mention washing the pillow as soon as you receive it in order to plump it up, and that is definitely true! However, it says to store the pillow in the packed-down form but I've found that when I leave my pillow that way it doesn't fluff back up when I unfold it... unless I wash it again. This is kind of an issue when travelling or camping, so I haven't been using the pillow as often as I'd like since it's not as reliable as I'd hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Burke

customer_reviews.title: Pricey. Puffy. It'll do.
customer_reviews.text: I just can't find a camping pillow I really like. This thing puffs up pretty nicely, but I don't like the internal texture. It's just chunks of foam shoved into a case. I find it slightly less comfortable than the inflatable kind, which offers more support, but this will last much longer. It's well made but seems pricey for what it is. If you aren't overly picky about your pillow (like I am), this one is probably a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: AvidConsumer

customer_reviews.title: Filling too chunky, didn’t like CA Prop 65
customer_reviews.text: I don’t like hotel pillows so ordered this for longer vacations. Ordered the large in cardinal and was a good sized pillow, just a tad smaller than my regular pillow. I had to let it puff up for 2-3 days, but didn’t like that the filling was chunks of foam, it felt weird on my head. Also got a little freaked about the California Prop 65 warning on the label, ended up returning.
customer_reviews.author: tin_can17

customer_reviews.title: Great pillow for camping, but not for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for backpacking. I was willing to let this pillow use up so much space in my backpack in exchange for comfort. Now that I’ve experienced backpacking for a longer period of time I cannot trade space for comfort. Have decided to keep this pillow as a camping pillow. Great and comfortable. Just not good enough for long backpacking trips where each inch in your backpack counts.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine 2019

customer_reviews.title: Value and comfort increase with time
customer_reviews.text: Got two of these for emergency use 2 months ago. Thought when I unwrapped them that I had been had taken. They first expanded to a kind of flat pillow But over time these guys have puffed up to a nice soft and supportive pillow that I use now not for a bed but for neck support and other spinal comfort issues. They are great and though I bought them based on the reviews just to do one job I have grown to really love them and put them to many uses, and intend to get more when the budget allows.
customer_reviews.author: Boz

customer_reviews.title: Great for backpacking trips (Medium size)
customer_reviews.text: I went through few light backpacking pillows, and this is by far the best. For me a good pillow is a must for a good sleep. I tried ultra light inflatable, but these do not breath and are not comfortable. This one takes more space and weight, but it is almost like a normal pillow. Don't get the small size, I had that for few backpacking trips and this is just not enough support for an adult, had to add some clothes under it. Now I got medium size - huge difference in comfort.
customer_reviews.author: SergeiS

customer_reviews.title: Took a while to fill out.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the medium. More than 30 minutes after unpacking, it was still flimsy and thin. I was very disappointed at first. After about 2 days, it finally seemed to fill out (which, I don't know how useful that is for traveling). The foam is a bit chunky and coarse, but I'm happy enough with it.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Lumpy and almost no support.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pillow to take backpacking and to replace the ol' jacket in a stuff sack deal. I opened the pillow up to let it fluff up for about an hour. It didn't really change and after reading reviews about it not changing after washing I decided to save myself the trouble and time and possibly compromising the ability to return it. It's so lumpy and so thin and offers little to no support. I tested it side by side with my usual method of putting a hoodie or jacket in a stuff sack, and the old makeshift method by far outweighed the comfort and support of thermarest pillow. So weak and so overpriced. Dang.
customer_reviews.author: Winston W.

customer_reviews.title: Your head will thank you....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pillow to use when I go tenting and this pillow is perfect for those needs. It rolls up super easy to make it compact to travel with and when it’s unrolled it expands very nicely. The only downside that I have found is that if you really want the pillow to be as firm and lofty as possible you are going to want to unroll as soon as you get to where you are going as I have found that it does take some time for the foam inside the pillow to loft up to its maximum potential.
customer_reviews.author: Ziggs

customer_reviews.title: Takes a while to expand. Pretty comfortable for a camp pillow.
customer_reviews.text: When I loosened the drawstring on this pillow, unrolled it and moved the fill around, it felt as there was very little to no fill inside the pillow. It took 5-6 hours for the fill inside the pillow to fully expand out and fill the voids, so to speak. If you have about 6 hours for the fill to expand before you want to go to sleep, it’s all good. If you’re backpacking, don’t even think about having it rolled up and in your pack as it won’t be fully “expanded” by the time you need it.
customer_reviews.author: ItsCorpsBoy!!!

customer_reviews.title: Great Camp Pillow
customer_reviews.text: I love this pillow. When you unpack it you will be worried that it is flat and lump. Just shake it vigorously for a minute and put it down. It will fluff up nicely over twenty minutes or so. The covering is nice and soft and the foam chunks work well and are comfortable for me. If you wait and unpack this pillow while you are slipping into your sleeping bag for the night, you will be disappointed. It needs to be shaken and allowed to decompress for 15-20 minutes. Some say put it in the dryer for a cycle, but I didn't have a need for that. Besides, dryers are hard to come by when camping or backpacking right?
customer_reviews.author: David Harlan

customer_reviews.title: Great camping pillow
customer_reviews.text: I have used this on a couple of overnight backpacking trips and at the beach. I think it is plenty comfortable and the "chunks" of foam other consumers have complained about have not been an issue for me. Give it some time to unpack once you unroll it and it works just fine. Only gave it 4 stars because it doesn't really pack down that small - if I were trying to backpack with a smaller pack, this might be an item i have to leave behind due to its size.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Amazing pillow for camping!
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is AMAZING! I've been using a blow-up pillow for camping and it was awful. Finally tried one of these and unless I'm doing a backpacking trip where I need ultra light gear, I'll be bringing this instead. When it arrives it feels a bit odd- throw it in the washer and dryer and it'll poof up nicely, bit still be compressible for storage. I also love that this is machine washable, because it's easy to get things dirty when your tent is on dirt/sand.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Great so far for NoT camping.
customer_reviews.text: So I purchased this item NOT for camping. I'm a firefighter. So on occasion I am sent to a different station. It was tiring packing a full size pillow into a ruck sack. This pillow is great for saving space in my seat bag that I use at work. So much more room for all of my personal items when moving from station to station. I would caution using this as a camping pillow though. When I unroll it, there is zero fluff to this pillow. I do not know if this would fluff up naturally. I am able to access a dryer at work so a quick fluff with heat will puffnit up and works well.
customer_reviews.author: flash739

customer_reviews.title: Lumpy
customer_reviews.text: Was pretty flat after purchase, I had to wash it to plump it up. Purchased for a summer camp for kid, had to fit sleeping bag and pillow in a pack so needed something compressed. Looks like it will work ok for reason purchased, but is quite big for a camping pillow. Does not compress very small. And is lumpy when it is fluffed up. May end up being a good car pillow, but unsure if I will keep, or If it was worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Noisy during the day

customer_reviews.title: Good Travel Pillow - a little large even when compressed
customer_reviews.text: I like the comfort of this pillow - much better than the u-shaped ones. Plus, this came in very useful at hotels where pillows were flat or one one was provided. If I re-order, I would probably buy the small one for on the plane - although the medium was perfect for use at hotels. I guess it really comes down to how much room you have for carting a travel pillow in your carry-ons. Certainly smaller than than the u-shaped when compressed. Easy to compress after you get the hang of it... and they fluff up very quickly after the first few uses. So not perfect - but not sure that the perfect travel pillow exists.
customer_reviews.author: Gungo

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel that expands just enough for a firm yet plush pillow
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit pricey, but it seems worth it. I bought the large version and it's not as large as I wanted it to be, but my fault for not checking dimensions. Packs down rather nicely, like a fat Pringles can. It is also comfortable but adds a bit of firmness. I like pillows I can sink my head into, but this pillow's not bad either, and doesn't get hard and lumpy like cheaper $5 small travel pillows. Washes easily with a tumble in the washing machine... and a short drying cycle will expand this thing to the fullest, if you don't want to wait for it to expand on its own or fluff it.
customer_reviews.author: Ray B.

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: I hoped it would compress more and fluff up faster. It’s not super comfy, but if you let it sit for a few hours it does expand quite a bit. Very lumpy, but, very cool that it’s the leftover bits of memory foam from other products. I love that they make use of all the materials. The case is super soft (denim), folds nicely (great design like you’d expect from them), but is fairly big (doesn’t pack super small). Perfect for my girlfriend who often has a need for a pilllow on the go! Slightly prefer the second one I got for her, but over time I bet this one will last longer and be preferred!
customer_reviews.author: Izzy

customer_reviews.title: Decent for a few days camping.
customer_reviews.text: You'll have to give it a few hours to fully inflate then fluff it a bit. It will compressed as you sleep on it, as to be expected. The weird smell when it first arrives will away in about a day or two. I do recommended wash and dry it at least once after left to inflate. Because it will better after you do that. I do not recommended pillow if you are someone who drools in your sleep. As it will absorbent it like a sponge. Maybe this can be stopped by putting Scotchgard or something on it. It's rolls up and travels easily.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Minimalist pillow
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this pillow three times so far for two weekend trips and one week long camping trips. My biggest issue is the loss of fluff after unrolling. The instructions do mention this. If you’re camping for only a day or two, this pillow will not be fluffy enough after compression. It took some time. Outside of that, the pillow did well for me. It’s soft and wide enough if you don’t move a lot while sleeping. It’s well constructed. It rolls and unrolls easily.
customer_reviews.author: clinton mayo

customer_reviews.title: Filling is lumpy.
customer_reviews.text: The filling in this pillow is very lumpy. It's like the materials clump together in bunches rather than staying uniform throughout the pillow. I thought I could remedy this by washing the pillow and putting it in the dryer with a tennis ball. It worked wonderfully for a few days, but then the filler started clumping together again. The outside material seems soft and of quality, I just wish the inside material was of similar quality.
customer_reviews.author: kittymom09

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality pillow
customer_reviews.text: These pillows are really nice. I didn't wash/dry first like they recommended. It took about 30 minutes for the little memory foam pieces to fully expand. After they expanded, I fluffed and shaped the pillow. It seems like it might take some time and muscle to get the pillow to turn inside it's self. I bought a separate ditty bag for it to into. The medium size pillow would be great for car camping, but probably not backpacking or using on an airplane. It would be kind of big for that.
customer_reviews.author: D. L. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: better than my real pillow
customer_reviews.text: this is actually so good i may buy more to sleep on full time. i got it for camping however, its so darn comfy i may replace my full time pillow with a large one of these fluffs right up by the way feels nice and soft NO smell what so ever like some of the foam stuff. takes at max 1-2 min to fully fluff depending how much you smoosh it and i super smoosh it in a compression sack doesnt seem to effect it what so ever.
customer_reviews.author: fox

customer_reviews.title: If You Want More, Get A Real Pillow
customer_reviews.text: I appreciate that this is Made in the USA, even if it is with domestic and imported parts. DISCLAIMER: I can sleep almost anywhere and on anything, a pillow and cot is a plus though. I use this for travel and for camping. If fluffs up pretty well and gives enough support even when it compresses to be comfortable for everyday use if you aren't a difficult sleeper. It packs up reasonably small.
customer_reviews.author: Cranny

customer_reviews.title: Great for home use or car camping.
customer_reviews.text: The x-large pillow is great for car camping or at home use (I’d get the small or med for hiking or traveling). When you first unroll the pillow - even out all the filling and then leave it sitting somewhere for a WEEK or so. It’s been compressed for a very long time and will expand considerably. After that, it’s very comfortable and rolls up easy. I don’t keep mine rolled up for storage as it then expands faster when you get to your campsite. Another great Therm-A-Rest product.
customer_reviews.author: D.E.

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Therm-a-Rest pillow several years ago and it still looks new. I mainly use it for camping. It is perfect for small sleeping areas such as a RV bed or camp cot. I like a head pillow and two side pillows. With this reversible pillow I can have three pillows. I decided to order the XL size. The Therm-a-Rest pillow is the easiest pillow to store compared to other camping pillows I use. I store the compressible pillows in a waterproof duffle so I'm ready to pack when I get the itch to go camping.
customer_reviews.author: campingfriend

customer_reviews.title: Needs constant fluffing and color bleeds
customer_reviews.text: I saw convincing reviews on YouTube but reality did not match. I washed it first thing and it doubled in size (yay!) but foam inside doesn't stay put. My head kept pushing it to either side leaving no support. I woke up constantly to pack the the foam to one side and fold over excess material. This was Medium size which is just wide enough for my large head. Also, good thing I put an old T-shirt over it because the dye still bled after washing. Stained my shirt red. 3 old shirts later it's still doing it. I don't use it now. I did learn I like that dimension of pillow so that's a plus! Lol.
customer_reviews.author: C. Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Travel Pillow Not Comfortable for Me
customer_reviews.text: Does not compact to a very small size -- takes up too much room in packing when trying to 'travel light'. Also, I do not like the lumpiness of the filler. The description of the item at the time of purchase does allude to it's feel, but I had not tried shredded foam before and did not know that I would not care for it. Others may not be bothered by this.
customer_reviews.author: Francher

customer_reviews.title: Mixed feelings
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a travel pillow for a long flight and this one got good reviews, but I can't say I'm happy with it. I tried puffing it like the tag suggested, but it still felt like a bag half full of shredded foam. I don't own a dryer, so I can't puff it up that way. I was really hoping for something with support, but I guess I'll see how it goes on my flight. I do like how compact it is rolled up.
customer_reviews.author: Saekit

customer_reviews.title: Wash and dry before you use!
customer_reviews.text: I bought my boyfriend and myself these travel pillows due to us traveling a lot for school. I definitely recommend washing and drying the pillow like the tag says to help it fully expand and boy it did! They are extremely fluffy and the perfect size for traveling. To store when we were changing planes, I just clipped them both on a carabiner to my purse. We love these. I see myself buying more of these when we need to.
customer_reviews.author: Makayla Smith

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend...
customer_reviews.text: The cover is nice, it turns into a carrying pouch. But, the filling is small pieces of chunked foam.. so the pillow is lumpy. Not worth returning but I should have just stuffed my clothes into a pillow case and used that as my pillow for my next camping trip.. saved a little money and been at least as comfortable. Maybe I will try to take out the foam pieces and fill with fiber fill....or, maybe not.
customer_reviews.author: D. Beardsley

customer_reviews.title: The pillow felt like it was lots of big cotton balls stuffed inside ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for 3 month backpacking trip. As i was traveling i didnt really have access to laundry all the time, so a dryer to fluff the pillow up wasn't readily available. The pillow felt like it was lots of big cotton balls stuffed inside the case. Very uncomfortable and not as compact as i thought, took up too much room in my backpack and had to get rid of it. Not ideal for traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Muranyi

customer_reviews.title: The cover material and design are excellent (I bought the large)
customer_reviews.text: Used this pillow to make my own DIY backpacking pillow. The cover material and design are excellent (I bought the large). The foam inside however looks like a homeless person threw away their bed and someone recycled it. Just plain awful foam. Lowest quality foam I've ever seen inside a pillow. Therm-a-rest needs to step up to the plate and use better foam. Come on guys, how much does it take to make this...3 dollars?
customer_reviews.author: Curious Designer

customer_reviews.title: Questionable product material
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't impressed with the foam material in this pillow. The contents are lumpy. And I was disappointed to learn on the product tag that the foam is potentially a carcinogen. I had purchased this pillow to use as a travel nursing pillow for my infant, but after reading the product warning which wasn't in the online product description, I didn't want it next to my baby. The pillow is well constructed though, so if you need a simply travel pillow and aren't concerned about the foam risks, then it's a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Vives

customer_reviews.title: Narrow range of applictions
customer_reviews.text: The pillow is surprisingly not very compressible. I bought the 'medium' size, and it's good for sleeping while car-camping but not much else. It compresses to slightly larger than a 1L nalgene bottle, and it's too bulky and heavy to use backpacking. I also can't imagine bringing it on an airplane due to its bulk. The filling material seems to be cubes or chunks of memory foam, which seemed odd at first but it's very comfortable once you give it some time to puff up.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Pillow after modifications
customer_reviews.text: The pillow was really puffy and had too much foam inside. I had to cut it open and remove some pieces for it to be more comfortable and more importantly more packable for backpacking use. After the surgery and re-sewing this pillow is my favorite out of 4 brands I own, I like it so much now that it’s my everyday pillow as well. If absolute pack-ability is the most important to you maybe go with a soft sided inflatable like the Cacoon Pillows, but they will never compete with the comfort from this pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Sitka Gear Fanatic

customer_reviews.title: Great pillow
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pillow, just not quite a 5 star pillow. It is pretty comfy, but after compressing it, it just doesn't com back to that super fluffy and wonderful pillow that it was right after it came out of the washing machine. If you wash it and never compress it I believe you would have an amazing pillow, but that kind of eliminates the whole purpose of a camping/hammock pillow in my book. The saving grace is that even though it doesn't puff back to that amazing fresh out of the wash fluffiness, it is still very comfortable. I would not stray from buying another one due to the above stated facts.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Ciarimboli

customer_reviews.title: Thermarest vs Trekology inflatable pillow for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: Couldnt decide between this and the Trekology inflatable pillow since both had great reviews and the inflatable pillow was cheaper and packed away so tiny so I bought both. I'm mad the Trekology pillow didn't work out for me since it was SO CONVENIENT, but I roll around a lot and that pillow is great for back sleepers who like firm pillows. I ended up keeping the Thermarest, I was able to comfortably sleep on my back, stomach, and side (the only comfortable part of camping). I got the medium and it was was the perfect size, it also packs up easily.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Great pillow
customer_reviews.text: Can’t believe the loft this pillow provides . First day it seemed very flat , but after being left out for a while it continued to gain loft . Eventually it becomes a FULLY supportive pillow ! Be patient and you’ll be amazed !
customer_reviews.author: Salvador Duran

customer_reviews.title: I love this Pillow for Camping!
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is awesome! It's a great price and it seems to be good quality so far. It compresses down quite a bit, but will fluff up to be a really nice thickness for side or back sleepers. I can't recommend this highly enough. I will be purchasing another one if need be. One important note: be sure to wash/dry this thing before you take it on your first camping trip. That will help to fluff it out even more. It does have a note about that on the tag, but it's good advice. I just tumble dried it on low heat after a cold wash. Love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: internalburn

customer_reviews.title: Not bad not great
customer_reviews.text: First I'm very picky about pillows. I'm a memory foam guy I like the extra firm support. This is a compressible pillow so over night. It does what it's designed to do! Compress! I will say it does fluff up really really well. Followed the directions, waited a few weeks. Very comfortable but by later that night it's not very good. For a packable pillow if you're going into the back country hike it will be tough to beat. Maybe one of the hybrid air/foam might be better? Not sure. Bang for your buck though it's gonna be hard to beat! Does what it's designed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I'll admit, I was disappointed when I unboxed it. The pillow seemed chunky, thin, and did not feel very supportive. I popped it in the dryer for a few minutes, and let it sit overnight, and it really fluffed out. I have already taken it backpacking once (yes I know it's too heavy for that, but I need a decent pillow.) It is as comfortable a pillow as I could justify carrying. The material is comfortable, it feels cool and soft. A great buy at this price, I got the cheapest fabric option in my size.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Krueger

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable. Best travel pillow this far
customer_reviews.text: I should have gotten the "Large" pillow had I known how comfortable this is. It doesn't take that much more room and even if it does the value of comfort outweighed the space and weight sacrifice for a good nights sleep. The trick to this pillow is to allow time to let the foam expand by fluffing and shaking the pillow and then let it rest for 15 minutes or more. This is a pillow you want to break out first during your campground set up.
customer_reviews.author: Arts & Craft Addict

customer_reviews.title: Good for camping
customer_reviews.text: Not bad. I ordered two, and one had a lot less filling than the other. Rolls up to a quarter of it's size. I don't like that the fabric is that "microfiber" style. Everything sticks to it. Not exactly a healthy pillow, being filled with foam that is likely flame retardant, it also has a tag with the California cancer warning.
customer_reviews.author: Monica K

customer_reviews.title: Firm washable travel pillow
customer_reviews.text: I now own three of these pillows which are used in our cars. They are comfortable and we like that they are firmer than some fluffy travel pillows. I have washed them whenever necessary and they come out great. My six kids want grab one almost every time they get in the car. I would have a dozen if they were a little less expensive. Their comfort and durability definitely make them a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Momofsix

customer_reviews.title: Great concept.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the medium and it is about the perfect size for sleeping in the car, plane or in my hammock. Rolled up, it lives in the door pocket of my 2017 Frontier. We do a lot of trips to go camping, canoeing or just a 100 miles to Granny and B-Paws house. I unroll the night before and my wife can sleep on the way. My wife didnt think she would likeot, but I just ordered one for her. Actually one for me, as mine is now officially hers. They really are perfect after a washing and fluffing, but leaving them open over night is really close.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch Steel

customer_reviews.title: Best addition to my backpack! Must have for travel!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pillow before a trip to Europe and have since taken it on almost every single flight for a year. There was one trip were I decided not to bring the pillow and I regretted it. It rolls up very tight so it's easy to pack. It needs time to expand, though, so I pull it out as soon as I board the plane. I've also used it in hostels, on bus rides, train rides. Sometimes just as a cushion on a seat. To me this is a must have travel item. I need to get one for my wife so we won't have to fight over it.
customer_reviews.author: Rockhopper92

customer_reviews.title: Impressed with camping pillow
customer_reviews.text: My son took this tenting and found it was quite comfortable. The rolled size is about two soda cans. I liked that it makes it own bag, a sac would have been lost the first day. No smell, soft and it came back in good shape after a week.
customer_reviews.author: MMM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Took this on a trip to Europe since I won’t use hotel pillows. Lightweight and comfy. Worked out great because it didn’t take up room in suitcase. Machine washable. I’d probably buy the next size up if purchasing again.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Z

customer_reviews.title: Way better than sleeping on an inflatable pillow.
customer_reviews.text: I'm really impressed with this pillow. I thought there had to be something better than an inflated pillow so I found this and thought I'd give it a try. I'm so glad I did. It fluffed up a bit within 15 minutes or so but I left it out overnight and it really fluffed up and had a nice firmness to it. As close to your home pillow as you'll get I think. I bought the small. It'll work great for backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Tobias Collins

customer_reviews.title: A great pillow
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for an excellent and reliable pillow for camping, this pillow will exceed your expectations. It is a little bulkier than some of the other options but absolutely worth the space it takes up. It can even just be strapped to the outside of your backpack for flying, etc. The XL size vs Large, I think the large does the job, but if you need something smaller, the medium size would do just fine if not as good as the large size pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Hoku

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for...
customer_reviews.text: I needed a pillow for a camping/travel and this is perfect. Not sure why some reviewers stated this pillow is flat. Makes sure you wash and dry the pillow and it fluffs up nicely. It fills up the whole pillowcase! I purchased the Large size....not too big and not too small. You can find the exact dimensions in the description. I can see using the pillow for air travel, road trips or camping.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Holaso

customer_reviews.title: most comfortable camping pillow
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to find a better one than this. Very comfortable. it does take time to reinflate if it's been kept wrapped up during a trip. It doesn't pack as small as air pillows, but these are way more comfortable than those. so I wouldn't recommend it for serious backpackers that do not have space. for a moto trip this was not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: kpy product reviews

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I was able to use this on a camping trip this past weekend and wow, this pillow is wonderful. I didn’t have time to wash and dry (as recommended by mfr) before my trip so I just put it in dryer and it puffed up nicely. I left it unrolled overnight and rolled it to pack (it rolls to a very nice compact size) the morning I left for camp. When I opened it up it was disappointingly flat but by the time I went to sleep it was puffy again! This pillow provided the most comfortable sleep I’ve ever had in my tent!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Wash and dry before you judge
customer_reviews.text: When I unpacked this I thought clearly everyone who had reviewed this had lost their mind. It is horrible when first unpacked. But after I washed and dried it like the small tag (that I never would have seen if not for rereading reviews) said, it fluffed up into an awesome pillow! And it still rolls up to take up minimal space. This will be perfect for my kids to sleep on the airplane.
customer_reviews.author: KJB

customer_reviews.title: Soft but sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The small amethyst pillow is my husband's ~ he's used it for almost a year, and it's still as good as the day it arrived. I loved that pillow too ~ finally ordering my own ~ a small one in red & a medium in denim. The red is a gorgeous bold color ~ the denim is prettier than I'd expected. All three pillows get daily use. The medium is perfect for TV watching ~ the small ones provide stability for back & knee problems in bed. Delightfully soft, yet the stuffing doesn't collapse under our (considerable) weight. I expect to enjoy these for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: NJ Gal

customer_reviews.title: Nice size
customer_reviews.text: I needed a pillow to put behind my back while on the airplane. I liked that it was a small and compact size, and would be easy to carry through the airport. The ability to roll into itself was nice, but I didn't think of the fact that it would need time to puff up after you unrolled it. It's memory foam so it conforms to you and doesn't stay the most supportive over time. It served it's purpose for the airplane, but I wish it would have stayed more firm.
customer_reviews.author: M. WalkerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Full sturdy comfy, but not easy to roll up
customer_reviews.text: This little turned out to be a very sturdy, full, comfortable little pillow. I thought it would be more portable but it is quite difficult to roll back up and doesn't reduce in size very well. So even the small size still takes up a significant amount of space. I tried the medium but it was less full and less comfortable than the small and just took up even more space. I took this on my fight overseas. Much better than the flat pillow they give you on the plane. Minus one star for not being easier to roll up and consequently not being quite as portable as hoped.
customer_reviews.author: G & K

customer_reviews.title: Put it in the dryer right out of the box! It's awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the medium. In these pictures you can see the medium is perfect fit for my sleeping pad (it's a large pad). I'm so exited to use it this weekend for camping! So when first comes out of the box it's flimsy for sure, but shake it up and move the foam around then stick it in the dryer for 10 mins and POOF!!! FILLED OUT FLUFFY PILLOW!! And it's soooo comfy!! Head does NOT come close to touching the ground. Highly recommend! Might buy a large to have for car camping!
customer_reviews.author: Angie Nicolletta

customer_reviews.title: Great Pillow
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is so impressive. Give it a few hours to expand upon opening, or even better - wash and dry it first. I was worried when I first unrolled it and found it thin, but when I came back a few hours later I was pleasantly surprised at how much thicker it had become. I’m currently using this pillow on a campervan trip around Iceland and have been very pleased with how much support it’s provided. My husband lost his during our layover in NYC and is pretty upset about it.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Hard to stuff back into bag; eventually insides deteriorate into random bits
customer_reviews.text: The pillow is not very comfortable to begin with, unless you really don't care what you're sleeping on. When you try to stuff it back in, you can hardly get it halfway. And after a few months of storage, when you unfold it, the inside has broken apart into pieces so that it feels like putting your head on a bag of gravel.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Peter A. Kwasniewski

customer_reviews.title: Like sleeping on Rubik’s cubes
customer_reviews.text: Terrible all around. Wanted a smaller pillow for sleeping in the van but it’s really uncomfortable. It’s a pillow so I don’t wanna sound pretentious as I’m sounding right now but just wanna make a point that if you have a job and you’ve earned money to purchase something I would strongly suggest something else.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Best hiking/camping pillow - tucks away into and doesn't take up much room in your pack.
customer_reviews.text: I actually purchased the medium and used it on a hiking trip. I am not a very large person and a pillow that is too lofty doesn't work for me, so I ordered another small one. Perfect! These pillows are very well made and I, like another person who reviewed them, would use them at home, also. Would definitely tell anyone that these are the best hiking/camping pillows that you can buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kim M.

customer_reviews.title: ( best word I got right now )
customer_reviews.text: I received this on 4.3.2018 - I'm not really sure what I was expecting. I guess for it to look as filled out as the picture. This little travel pillow comes tightly rolled up and when you undo it; it is slightly floppy..( best word I got right now ). Since I got this for an upcoming car trip in 3 weeks. I will give a better update later. Will have to see how it does on the trip.
customer_reviews.author: shalew

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: Great pillow. Got it for camping. Made in the USA! with US and imported materials. High quality pillow. I got the small for weight and space purposes. I didn't want to be out there with a popped air pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Shon

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable and bulky
customer_reviews.text: A little too bulky for my needs as backpacking/camping. I'm not a fan of the recycled memory foam bumps in this pillow. It's either too flat, or if you fluff it up and push all the foam to one side it feels bumpy and rigid. If you're car camping or close to a vehicle: just bring a regular sized pillow. If you're backpacking: inflatable pillows will save you weight and bulk (and comfort most likely.)
customer_reviews.author: Chris Glenz

customer_reviews.title: Got this pillow for lumbar support
customer_reviews.text: I did not even realize how much back pain I was having until I used this pillow during all my travels and it started to disappear! I took over 5 flights with this pillow and have used it on road trips and I LOVE IT! I got it after it was discovered that I have a herniated disc in my lumbar spine and it was honestly one of the best purchases I've made. I did attach a carabiner to the string to make it easier to carry when not sitting down, but this pillow is easy to carry and easy to clean! great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Kandyce Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Wash on GENTLE
customer_reviews.text: Super cute pattern. Definitely wash it before use so it’s not as lumpy, but use GENTLE cycle and dry on LOW heat. Mine was even a little damp when I pulled it out and I let it finish air drying. I didn’t want it to come apart like some other pillows did! But I found that the small size was too small for me, as I’m a bigger woman (5’8” and plus sized) and I like to sleep on my side. But I’ll keep this one for other purposes, like between my knees when sleeping to help my back, or when traveling on a plane.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith R.

customer_reviews.title: Lumpy with Gaps of No Fill, Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: I am a backpacker of over 25 years, but purchased this pillow to take with me for chemo treatments. The colors are nice (purple/black), but the actual pillow itself is useless. There is barely any fill inside, lumpy with gaps in the pillow of having no fill, which when resting your head, you are hitting hard surface. I had more luck with rolling up backpacking clothing and putting it under my head. Love Therm-A-Rest ProLite Sleeping Pads, but this pillow product is awful.
customer_reviews.author: Katie R.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Bought this pillow for a long flight. Unrolled it to discover it is about half full of large, lumpy, irregular chunks of firm filler. It expanded just enough to make it very difficult to get back into the cover. There's no way it would be comfortable or even useful when first unrolled. The flight would be over before it actually became a pillow -- if it ever does. I'm shocked it has so many positive reviews.
customer_reviews.author: MLWinPDX

customer_reviews.title: Good pillow little small
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a good pillow but small. It fluffed up fine after unrolling it and yes it is made of that chunky material. My only issue is that I ordered the large one and it was not that big. I recommend this for backpacking because it is so light but if you’re car camping get something larger.
customer_reviews.author: schottone

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected!
customer_reviews.text: I felt like the reviews must be hype. But this pillow is great. Definitely wash and tumble dry low for incredible increase in loft. Rolled up it works great as a lumbar support on the plane, and opened up you can move the foam bits around to get the right ergonomics. It is surprisingly supportive. I found the small to be perfect for plane travel. Rolled up I tuck it under the top handles of my Fvällraven backpack (my favorite personal item for travel) and it stays put. To be honest I’m using it at home now daily!
customer_reviews.author: C McD

customer_reviews.title: Pros and Cons:
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this pillow to take on a backpacking trip. This pillow is the Cadillac of backpacking pillows. It takes up more room than any other backpacking pillow I have used which is it's biggest Con but when unpacked and allowed to expand there is nothing like it. If you don't have the extra space in your pack then this might not be the pillow for you. It's probably takes up about 2 times the space of a regular backpacking pillow but when expanded, it's nearly the size of a regular house pillow. When I was younger, I didn't need a good pillow and wouldn't bother with bringing something like this. But now, I won't go backpacking without it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ideal Comfort, Fairly Compact
customer_reviews.text: Skeptical of foam cube filling but it was impressively comfortable and functional. Not as compact as inflatable pillows but so much more comfortable. Not too heavy either. Worth the size & weight. Good for casual backpack camping. Consider lighter (though less comfortable) alternative for long-term hiking. Would like pillowcase included for protection & easy cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: SKallen

customer_reviews.title: I'm amazed these have any positive reviews
customer_reviews.text: I can't get over the fact that these have positive reviews. When we unboxed them, we couldn't stop laughing... they were just two cloth bags with a few foam pebbles in them. I laid them out for over a day and fluffed them often to see if they'd get any better, and they didn't change at all. These are great for anyone who loves sleeping on a loose stack of softish rocks.
customer_reviews.author: Kasi Allen

customer_reviews.title: Wash & Dry FIRST
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a size small in Amethyst. I just received my pillow today and upon opening it, it was NOT fluffy. I fluffed with my hands and left it to sit for about 30 min. and it was not plumping up. So as the directions on the tag said I washed it and dried it and when i got it out of the dryer it was SO FLUFFY!! I haven't used it yet.. i bought it for an upcoming trip to Co. But my husband has one that is about 2 years old and its still perfectly fluffy.
customer_reviews.author: A.Gaines

product_meta.title: Therm-a-Rest Compressible Travel Pillow for Camping, Backpacking, Airplanes and Road Trips, Amethyst
product_meta.description: The Therm-a-Rest Compressible Travel Pillow is a true travel essential. Ideal for anyone seeking sleep and comfort on-the-go, it offers all the support of home bedding in a small, convenient, and lightweight package for camping, plane travel, car trips, backpacking, trekking, and festivals. Easily compressible for packing into a backpack, duffel, suitcase, or tote, the pillow expands into a 4-inch thick, soft and squishy pillow for head, neck, and back support. The brushed polyester cover is soft against skin for cozy comfort, promising sleep and relaxation in places where getting a little shut-eye can be a challenge. Rest comes even easier knowing that the lofty urethane filling is upcycled—the byproduct of Thermarest mattresses, utilizing the waste generated during production. The Therm-a-Rest Compressible Travel Pillow is available in four sizes: Small measures 12x16x4 inches expanded, 13x4x4 inches compressed, and weighs 7 ounces; Medium measures 14x18x4 inches expanded, 14x5x6 inches compressed, and weighs 9 ounces; Large measures 16x23x4 inches expanded, 16x7x7 inches compressed, and weighs 12 ounces; XL measures 16.5x27x4 inches expanded, 18x7x7 inches compressed, and weighs 15 ounces. Before use, shake and fluff pillow to restore loft. For maximum loft, machine wash and tumble dry. Made in the USA.
feature_bullets: Ultralight (7 ounce) compressible travel pillow with soft foam filling that packs down small for road trips, plane travel, camping, and backpacking
Foam filling expands into a 4-inch thick pillow for head, neck, and back support in tents, cars, planes, and other tough-to-get-comfortable places
Compact design packs into a backpack, duffle, suitcase, or tote; drawstring and cord lock keeps pillow securely compressed when not in use
Brushed polyester cover is soft against skin for comfort; lofty urethane fill is an upcycled byproduct of Thermarest mattresses
Pillow measures 12 x 16 x 4 inches (13 x 4 x 4 inches compressed) and weighs 7 ounces; before use, shake and fluff to restore loft; machine washable; made in the USA
